state.description: name of the latest state of the current communication: CallOriginated, CallDelivered, CallEstablished, ect. Could be an enum with defined states.

time.description: Date and time when the state changed for the given participant

duration.description: Time in milliseconds how of how long the call has been in previous states for the given participant

name.description: Name of the participant communicating as defined in schema.org

groupName.description: Name of the group for which the participant is representing in the communication

firmName.description: Name of the participant's firm represnted in the communication

timeZoneOffset.description: The UTC timezone offset for the participant

participant.description: Specific details about a participant in a given communication

involvement.description: How the participant joined the communication. Did they initiate it, receieve a request or join an ongoing communication?

address.description: The address of the participant. It can be a URL, a username or any other type of address used to reach this participant.

joinTime.description: Date and time when the participant joined the conversation

exitTime.description: Date and time when the participant exited the conversation

type.description: The type of communication service which is populated in this JSON (dialtone, ringdown, SMS, , etc)

comUUID.description: Universally Unique Identifier for this communication for a given participant. Will be unique across all call records.

universalID.description: A ID the underlying platform may provide to link multiple calls within the system. For example where multiple calls are in conference some systems may link them with a universal call id.

csID.description: The ID generated by the platform managing the communication for the target user.

startTime.description: The time when the communication started

endTime.description: The time when the communication terminated

activeDuration.description: The duration the participant was actively engaged in the communication (for example removing hold states), in milliseconds

state.description: The state of the communication when the record was generated

name.description: The actual platform used for example telephony platforms could be could be Cisco, Avaya, BT ITS, IPC, Ect

id.description: The location / ID of the platform to uniquely identify it.

participants.description: List of participant objects describing the other parts on the call

deviceInfo.description: Information about the device that generated this record

deviceInterface.description: The device as used to handle the communication

buttonName.description: The name on the consuming app for the connection

channelID.description: Identifier for the resource (channel, extension, ect)

data.description: Information about the file associated with the communication record (vr file, transcription, sms, ect )

fileName.description: The name of the file as stored

checksum.description: Checksum of the file used to verify the file integrity. The hash values are compared and, if they match, confirms that the data has not been altered. It can be stored in one of the supported algorithms listed in type enum

type.description: Hash algorithm used on file checksum.

hash.description: Checksum of the recording file in the selected hash type

archiveDate.description: The date the file should be removed date-time format

quality.description: Any data providing quality stats on the file.  For example for Voice Recording or Transcription details may be provided defining the suggested qulaity of the file.

additionalProperty.description: Used to hold any specific data or properties from a given system which have not been explicitly defined in the standard.
